website_summaries.verdict: Moderately priced for the number of handy features built into the DH 40 Pontoon, such as an anti-drag system and a quick connect plug, come together to make this electric anchor winch a premium option.
cons: This electric anchor winch runs on a 12-volt battery, but it isn’t included

customer_reviews.title: Strong performance.  Solves the "loose anchor storage" issue completely.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in combination with a 30 lb. anchor. This unit is the real deal. It is heavy-duty and the motor is strong. I installed it myself in about 1 hour. The hardest part of the job was getting up the nerve to drill the first hole (and eventually 3 more) in the deck of my new pontoon. Suggestion: Read all the instructions carefully and then decide where you want it. Next, set it in carefully into position, double or triple check your clearances as the anchor travels up and down, measure everything three times and drill the hole. After the first hole you can't turn back so it gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard S

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used 1 time worked perfect. 2nd time i dropped anchor and tried to bring anchor in; relay on circuit board burnt out. Then started to research and find out Minnkota dealer in Twin cities sells over 134 new circuit boards a year. Item has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need more then a 20 lb anchor
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine. I think my anchor is to light for it. It anchor goes down but after about 10 feet I need to assist pulling the rope off the spool. Not hard just enough to keep it going. Pulling up the anchor it sounds like it skips teeth on the wheels. Don't know if that's normal. I paid more to have it installed on the boat then I paid for the Deckhand, so I can't take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Anchors Away with ease.
customer_reviews.text: What a great anchor winch. Also bought remote switch for this winch. 1. Push rocker switch in down position and release - anchor goes down and stops with a bit of slack. 2. Put rocker switch in off position and and winch locks. 3. Push and hold rocker switch in up position - anchor is raised and stored horizontal in the dock. Return switch off position. You can then wash off anchor with a electric pump sprayer ( my next .marine purchase).
customer_reviews.author: Lester O Richmond

customer_reviews.title: 25’ Pontoon with 30# Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Put on my 25’ pontoon with a 30# anchor. Much easier and safer to lower and, more importantly, raise the anchor. I installed the winch on the bow (front) and had the local NAPA store add 8 gauge wires, with moisture proof couplings, to run to the battery in the stren (rear). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wathen

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for $215 each, my dad talked me into , I'm glad he did, more than I wanted to spend but worth it, you can hook a remote switch to it which plugs right so you can put next to the winch & don't have to get up & go to the other end of boat to put the other anchor down (MinnKota Deckhand 40 Remote switch), you will love it, a little noisy but I can deal with it. This is what fishing is suppose to be like (play not work). Got them at end of May, been out 20 times & they work great, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Fred G. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: very stong
customer_reviews.text: This unit is super well made. After reading the other sad reviews from the other makers, I decided that it was worth an addition 50 bucks to go with one that will not fail. Two of the bolt holes are located under the motor and tough to get to. Persistence and a universal joint got it done. Again I am so glad I bought this with a 30 pound river anchor and it holds my 20 ft pontoon boat against the cumberland river current.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Expensive to work only one time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband in sept last year for Christmas he just installed and we used for the first time this weekend and it will not hold the anchor up after using one time. Very expensive to not work more than one time
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Lane

customer_reviews.title: Good quality so far
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a five star for install but the lid does not raise up very high for when you need inside the compartment, the wires will unplug if you raise the lid very much. Pretty easy to install and seems like it has good strength as it pulled up 35 lbs of weight with no issue. This unit does work better with over 30 lbs or so on it then it does with only 18, with only 18 the unit did not uncoil very well on its own, I had to help pull the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Greg English

customer_reviews.title: it did NOT come with the remote switch
customer_reviews.text: this is a very well made anchor winch, it easily lifts my 25 pound anchor. it was easy to install and works great. But when I purchased it the site said it included the remote switch, but it didn't. So I ended up ordering it separately, as this was for a pontoon. And I didn't want to go to the front of the pontoon every time it was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Oly45

customer_reviews.title: Pain to install
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to disassemble the entire winch. This means unplugging wires to get the cover out of the way. Poorly designed for DIY installation and I mean poor! Performance seems to rate 4, or 5 stars, but the 1/2 day to install subtracts. Go to YouTube to get an idea of how to mount, enclosed instructions are next to useless, with very few drawings on how to take the whole winch apart. Rest is mumbo jumbo, mostly text.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. John

customer_reviews.title: Looks heavy duty, haven't hooked up yet
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 22' Tritoon boat, works Great, I also use it with a 30 pound anchor it has only tripped 2 times when I got it in a bind the other brand I used before would trip almost every time I used it, I would buy this one again if something happened to it. I also bought the remote switch and mounted it in the back of the boat where I can stand up and look down at the anchor and push the button and watch it up-and-down without having to bend over or use my foot it's worth the extra for the remote button to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: No ropes to trip on
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one as I bought a new boat super easy to install no ropes to trip on and with the remote switch you can place your anchor and remove it from the driver seat
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Too weak for a 20 pound anchor
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Used on my Sea Ark Predator with a 30 lb anchor had to change to a 20 lb because the winch is so weak. I have it connected to its own new deep cell battery. Just a weak wench, will not even seat the 20 pounder into the pulley system.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Boy was this an improvement. I had an anchor mate on my previous boat that was noisy and prone to backlash. No more with this one. Quiet, and the auto stop / slow release feature allows the anchor to set perfectly. Get the remote wiring and it’s easy for one person on a tiller boat to stay on the engine until the anchor is set. Worth the few extra dollars. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: david m. cronk

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install. First trip out anchor was put ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to install. First trip out anchor was put down retrieved and second use anchor would NOT go down. sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn

customer_reviews.title: Cover needs to be able to open to 90degrees!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure the manufacturer can spare 4” more wire on the connections. Plan on extending them so you can see they are connected when before you cover it up and secure the cover. It seems to be a good product, but that is just cheap. I’m sure it is to keep from slack interfering with winch So be sure to secure out of way of moving parts.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Massuccy

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: 2 purchased and within a few months using maybe 3 times stop working. Ok purchased another and sure enough stop working. Tried everything to fix and sounds like relays clicking AND THEN nothing. JUNK. I should now use these for the anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Moulder

customer_reviews.title: Customer support
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars based on what happend. Did not work when installed called minn kota directly and they advised me the it was fried mother board. I am reordering and shipping back this to give them another shot. On the install portion it was extreamly easy to install on my bass boat, 10 minutes tops! The customer service on both ends of Amazon and minn kota are outstanding
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Gill

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Expectation not met.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in the spring for my duck boat. First time out it failed to lock when deployed. Began working remainder of day. (Water depth less then 10 feet). Second day anchor deployed by it self while launching boat. Went ahead and lifted anchore into stored position and it locked. When I arrived at my hunting area no anchor and half spool of line. Anchored had deployed and locked and propeller cut off $60 anchor. Took it to repair facility and they said there is a issue plus while there another person showed up with same issue. Even if repaired I lost a bunch of time and a new anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hojara

customer_reviews.title: No more pulling up or letting down back breaking anchor lines!
customer_reviews.text: I just realized I wrote my review for this awesome machine on the remote switch that is purchased separately! So I’ll say it again, this thing is worth it’s weigh in gold! What a back saver! We don’t hesitate to move from one fishing spot to another anymore! It’s on our 21’ Alumaweld Jet Boat we highly recommend it!!! Thanks for all the reviews, that’s what sold us on this beauty!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorna K Gowan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Addition to My Boat
customer_reviews.text: The anchor winch does an great job raising and lowering the anchor. The drag function is excellent, too. It allows more rope to be let out automatically when there is tension in the rope. Installation was fairly simple though I recommend purchasing lock nuts to use instead of the included regular nuts. The nuts can loosen from the vibration of the winch. I also recommend purchasing and installing the remote. All-in-all, I don't miss wrestling with the anchor and rope. One negative is that the power cables that attach to the battery are too short. I needed to purchase extensions for cables.
customer_reviews.author: mark hackbarth

customer_reviews.title: The circuit board burned out peace of junk don't
customer_reviews.text: The circuit board burned out peace of junk don't buy
customer_reviews.author: ROSEMARY   SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Plastic roller
customer_reviews.text: The roller in the davit is made of brittle plastic. First time I retrieved the anchor one of the edges broke. This part shouild be made of rubber or a plastic that won't break.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Up Switch broke after just a couple of uses. Very disappointed that I paid for a name brand and it is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Installation and a cracked cover were difficult. MinnKota very responsive and replaced the cracked cover immediately. Installation was difficult, but not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Unit
customer_reviews.text: Installed on our pontoon boat. Works great. Easy to operate and install.
customer_reviews.author: S Baugh

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDIG, Great item you need to get one
customer_reviews.text: I love it is all automatic. I have know dislikes. You just push the button up or down. All good, easy peezee
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Busby

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: I bought two deckhand 40 one for the front and back of my 17ft fishing boat. I started out with a 30 lb anchor and it drained the battery very fast or would break the fuse. So I went to 20lb, it works good with a 20 but still pops the fuse or causes my fish locators to pop off. The deckhands draw a lot of amp/volts I'm told especially when they are in a mucky bottom. I wish I would have stuck my money in spot lock trolling motor or a talon. I'm not really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Meister

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product that I have bought . This is the third wench used three times now it will not role up just like the other two.
customer_reviews.author: ed roberts

customer_reviews.title: I liked it was easier to run anchor
customer_reviews.text: I liked it was easier to run anchor,but did not like when I pulled anchor up the button stuck and backslashes and kept running when trying to push stop button,there was no release button,so I could re coil.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to have for river fishing
customer_reviews.text: Best thing to have for river fishing. Puts the fun back into drifting rivers and anchoring to fish deep holes. Simple to install and pulls a 40lb anchor up in swift moving waters easily. I highly recommend this item for anyone that fishes in rivers.
customer_reviews.author: Tim White

customer_reviews.title: The shoulder saver
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great ,Now it is so easy to move around without fighting the anchor and wearing your arm and shoulders out would recommend it to anyone who loves to fish out of a boat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tougher to install than I imagined, had to purchase battery cables and remote control separately.
customer_reviews.author: Guinness

customer_reviews.title: makes life easy
customer_reviews.text: after pulling anchors for years...what was i thinking...great back saver!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good product, although fuse breaker has tripped twice in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, although fuse breaker has tripped twice in the two weeks I've been using the anchor. Not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Adams

customer_reviews.title: MinnKota Deckhand 40 Electric Anchor Winch
customer_reviews.text: Checked customer reviews on lesser priced anchor winches and kept coming back to the MinnKota. Excellent quality, easy to install and raises a heavy anchor with speed and power. I opted for the 20 LB. anchor and it works great with the winch. I purchased the optional corded remote and it works great as well. I fish from the front of my Tracker and the winch is mounted on the stern. Makes fishing much more enjoyable when you can push a button and stay on a brush pile or other structure.Wind is not as big a factor as it was.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Morris

customer_reviews.title: Definite Back Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I have done in years. I anchor a lot when fishing and have been manually pulling up the anchor. I can now operate it with my toe. A definite back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Whitsitt

customer_reviews.title: Anchor Winch
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful not to have to raise and lower the weight manually at our senior citizen age.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product for use on a boat!!
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a great product. Worked great for three times out on the boat.. the fourth time it wouldn't work.. Checking it over found the motor had gotten water in it, seems it has vent holes & isn't sealed at all for use on a boat or near the water.. or even when it rains.. We have this mounted on the front of a pontoon boat 23 foot about 45 inches above the water.. Didn't even have it installed two weeks. It also look used like it was a rebuilt!
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Gray addition to our pontoon boat works great wish I had bought it sooner
customer_reviews.author: JERRY W, COUCH

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. No more pulling anchor by hand.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and worth every penny. No more straining my back pulling a 30lbs anchor in all the time. Put it on a 22 foot pontoon.
customer_reviews.author: Rgrim75

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Way better than hauling up a 30# anchor by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Maaske

customer_reviews.title: I am disabled and this winch seams to work great and really saves the back when raising or lowering ...
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and this winch seams to work great and really saves the back when raising or lowering the anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I've used it only 3 times but so far it's great on the back of my boat. Sure beats getting up from the front of my boat (it's a front stick steer) To go put anchor out or pull it in at the back of the boat. Much safer
customer_reviews.author: Moore

customer_reviews.title: Proven over time for me!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this item on my boat for over 7 years. When they needed replacing I simply ordered the identical item so that installation was simple and quick as I used the same wiring and holes for the replacements as the originals. Was simple..
customer_reviews.author: tringram

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for fishing
customer_reviews.text: I've used the power anchor about ten times this summer and it pulls the anchor (25 lb) with ease. Make it easy and fast to move from spot to spot.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: I purchase 2 Deckhand 40 and installed both had problem ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchase 2 Deckhand 40 and installed both had problem with reset button and had to take off and take to a minnkota dealer to fix not very happy
customer_reviews.author: william t. laity

customer_reviews.title: ... are in our 60's and this product is the best thing we have bought for our 20 foot Targa ...
customer_reviews.text: The wife and I are in our 60's and this product is the best thing we have bought for our 20 foot Targa Tracker boat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Great other than weight of anchor required
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Only bad is the weight of the anchor required is on the high end of heavy size.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This was awesome. Just bolt it down and power it up. Motor seems nice and strong. Lowers until there is no pressure on the line (ie bottoms out). Raises quick and stows automatically.
customer_reviews.author: TK6790

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Pontoon!
customer_reviews.text: Anything that makes anchoring a pontoon easy deserves 5 stars. I like the rounded plastic case that’s kind to toes if you happen to accidentally step on it. Let’s see how it holds up...
customer_reviews.author: Jowie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: When i got it it didn't work, i tried to get a hold of someone and no response. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: troy Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, not the easiest thing to install.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product works as advertised. Not the easiest thing in the world to install. I would recommend this product as one of the best electric anchors on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: mounted under deck, out of sight and not taking up valuable deck space
customer_reviews.author: ed bates

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The instruction manual is poor quality and the photos are black and white and appear they are from a personal B&W home printer. But the unit itself is GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Velotta

customer_reviews.title: not to buy one
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't go down quick or fast enough I have to more than 400ft were I want to anchor i can throw the anchor out faster by hand
customer_reviews.author: RAUL

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Make sure you get the biggest battery that you can afford for this. I had a 24 and it was no cutting it. I now have a 29 and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Legitor

customer_reviews.title: Sticks !
customer_reviews.text: Had to add weight to anchor. Still sticks about 1/2 the time.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: up down excellat anchor retrieval system have yused it many times in the last 2 weeks

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it . Every time I bring the anchor up it goes back down on it's own. Ordered a new circuit board which is about everything in the system and I have the same problem. I expected a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill  Payne

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how quite it is compared to the Trac version.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Too bulky, but works well. Needs to be more compact.

customer_reviews.title: ... have the same one on my boat it works perfect would not be without it so I bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the same one on my boat it works perfect would not be without it so I bought this one for my brother. No rope laying around and no more back breaker pulling anchor up only a push button

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ticket! Absolutely love it! Buy the remote switch too!

customer_reviews.text: Husbands birthday gift. He loves it and it works great.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this winch. Fast, strong, quiet, self adjusting if boat moves some.

customer_reviews.title: great for an old man with arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Luv both the remote and electric anchor winch, great for an old man with arthritis.

customer_reviews.title: Anchors away!
customer_reviews.text: This deckhand 40 anchor winch is the greatest,have the 25lb.rector anchor attatched to it and it works just fine,cover mounts are a little flimsy,otherwise a great unit.

customer_reviews.title: GOTTA HAVE!!! :-)
customer_reviews.text: Its a.must especially when you get older!! Product is a perfect 10

customer_reviews.title: The anchor works great but I was lucky it was still there when ...
customer_reviews.text: The anchor works great but I was lucky it was still there when I got home because it was left on my front door step for anyone to take.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product ! Enjoyed fishing so much more this summer!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation with the quick detach mount. Works and holds great with my Polar Kraft Outlander 186 CC.

customer_reviews.title: The anchor mate is always a great thing to have on our pontoons
customer_reviews.text: The anchor mate is always a great thing to have on our pontoons. They work great and MinnKotta support I team is very helpful if you have an issue..

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount. Works well. Looks great mounted next to minn Kota trolling motor.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fantastic purchase, works great on my 161/2 ft. alum. river bass boat.

customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best investment I've made in my boat. I fish rivers and lakes in a Targa V18. This thing deploys and retreive my 40lb anchor with ease. Makes life so much easier when moving from spot to spot. Comes with 100ft of anchor rope and you'll need a 40lb anchor at a minimum.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really like this item. Works great--saves a lot of muscles!

customer_reviews.title: best damn electric anchor ive ever had
customer_reviews.text: best damn electric anchor ive ever had ! pros : works , pulls anchors like there paper weights , easy to read instructions , good rope included , quiet cons : have to take apart to install notes: i install this at the front of a wood boat with bolts with had to take off top cover to put in bolts , i also sunk the boat with battery still attach for 4 hours under water i pulled boat out it still ran wonderfully i have had no issues at all i got a 25lbs anchor on it is like nothing is there when using it get this if you hate pulling up anchors when fishing by hand!!
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Love the minnkota anchor mate.
customer_reviews.text: Love this anchor mate, the only way to go. Minnkota! Mines on a 18 ft sportfish and im glad i got the bigger one. Perfect with the quik release plate.
customer_reviews.author: Sage K

customer_reviews.title: Minn kota at its best
customer_reviews.text: 20 lb anchor 50 feet down with a strong current....no sweat. Makes the dreaded anchor up and move a lot easier for this old man. With a mounting bracket I can swap my trolling motor in its place for different types of fishing.
customer_reviews.author: K9comet

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate add on to eliminate dirty messy anchor rope all over, and for ease of deployment.
customer_reviews.text: Get this one, even for a 20lb anchor. I added extra switches in parallel to operate from the bow and console, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: i installed this winch and have been using it for a little over a month now with no problems so far so good,if you install this on a small boat be sure to have at least a 20 lb anchor or this winch will not work right. i got this winch because we have a lot of limbs and stumps in the lake we fish ,that hang up on anchors this winch handles them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: FISHHAWK

customer_reviews.title: Install the Minn Kota deck 40 looks awesome on my Jon boat works awesome on dry land ...
customer_reviews.text: Install the Minn Kota deck 40 looks awesome on my Jon boat works awesome on dry land have wait tell spring back on water see how deck 40 works I am very confident going work very well
customer_reviews.author: G money

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because the 25 lb electric anchor winch ( a different brand) I had was constantly binding up inside the gears. My plan was to use this with a 30 lb anchor and it is a success. I did have to add a plate on the back of my boat to extend the pulley outward. That was just a function of my boat however, and I'm hopeful this anchor winch will continue to do the job!
customer_reviews.author: skinny guy

customer_reviews.title: Go to have!
customer_reviews.text: Havnt installed yet, this is my second one the first one was great wore it out and can't live without a new one. Makes life easier and safer.

customer_reviews.text: Working great, takes the misery out of lifting the anchor. Used it for a week of fishing and never failed.

customer_reviews.title: Product works great. I'd give it a 5 star on performance ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. I'd give it a 5 star on performance but it was larger than I expected and takes up a fair amount of deck space. I definitely recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: MinnKota Deckhand 40 Electric Anchor Winch (40 Lbs. Capacity)
product_meta.description:
Size:One SizeAutomatically raise and lower your anchor at the touch of a button. Deckhand 40 has a 40-lb anchor capacity (anchor not included). Pre-spooled with 100 feet of 800-lb test nylon rope. Universal davit can be mounted at base of Deckhand or in remote position on boat deck. Davit also stows anchor horizontally to eliminate anchor swing. Anchor shackle allows for quick changes between anchors. A special anti-drag system senses the bottom to allow for controlled drifting. Runs on 12-volt battery (not included). Remote accessory (sold separately) allows for 25' corded remote operation. DH 40 is designed to work with anchors weighing at least 20 lbs. and not more than 40 lbs.

AMAZON.COM
Stay on top of things with the Minn Kota Deckhand 40 Electric Anchor Winch. The Deckhand 40 makes your fishing trips easier by allowing you to raise and lower a 20- to 40-pound anchor with no more than a touch of a button, so keeping track of that bounty of fish is no sweat. The Deckhand lets you drop anchor with precision and ease and is compatible with a number of Minn Kota accessories that make raising and lowering the anchor even more of a snap, including the corded remote and the MKA-16-02 Quick Release Bracket. The Deckhand 40 runs on a 12-volt battery (not included) and comes with 2-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Electric anchor winch makes fishing boat navigation and placement convenient and effortless
Davit can be mounted horizontally to stop anchor swing
Handles anchors up to 40 pounds; pre-spooled with 100 feet of 800-pound Test nylon rope
Comes with mounting hardware and installation instructions; compatible with other Minn Kota accessories
